page.title: 13Industry - Flour Mill
page.content: {Long Stratton Mill}produces flour and animal pellets, most of which are distributed locally to farmers and merchants. The products are made from locally produced grain. The pellets vary in size from less than 1cm to about 6cm and they are fed to pigs and cattle. The flour is made by rolling wheat and sieving out the bran and husk. The bran is bagged for sale and used in the production of pellets. The flour which is plain is sent for retail. {The mill is built on the site of a {former windmill, of which the 200 year {old tower remains.}Thirteen workers are employed by the company and a fleet of lorries provides transport for the raw materials and products. The mill has been owned by the same family for many generations.
